attributes.action: Every 3 Years Matters: Stop the 5-Year Smear Test Plan
attributes.additional_details: Maintaining the 3-year schedule prioritizes women's health and ensures a proactive approach to cancer prevention. While advancements in HPV testing have improved screening accuracy, the longer gap increases the risk of missing rapidly progressing cases, especially among younger women or those with less predictable health patterns.
attributes.background: Regular 3-year screenings provide a safer buffer, allowing for timely intervention before changes become serious. Extending the interval could lead to delayed diagnoses, greater anxiety, and potentially higher treatment costs in the long run.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/729981
